name: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
author: Robert C. Martin
synopsis: A guide to writing clean code that is easy to understand, maintain, and modify. Covers principles, patterns, and practices for improving code quality.

name: Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
author: Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, John Vlissides
synopsis: Classic book on design patterns, providing solutions to common software design problems. Includes examples in Java.

name: Code Complete: A Practical Handbook of Software Construction
author: Steve McConnell
synopsis: Covers best practices and techniques for writing high-quality code. Addresses design, construction, testing, and maintenance.

name: The Pragmatic Programmer: Your Journey to Mastery
author: Andrew Hunt, David Thomas
synopsis: Offers practical advice for improving coding skills and becoming a better developer. Covers topics like code organization, debugging, and testing.

name: Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code
author: Martin Fowler
synopsis: Explains the process of refactoring code to improve its design, readability, and maintainability. Offers practical techniques and examples.

name: The Mythical Man-Month: Essays on Software Engineering
author: Frederick P. Brooks Jr.
synopsis: A collection of essays on software engineering, discussing project management, scheduling, and the challenges of large-scale development.

name: Domain-Driven Design: Tackling Complexity in the Heart of Software
author: Eric Evans
synopsis: Introduces domain-driven design principles and patterns for building complex software systems. Emphasizes collaboration between domain experts and developers.

name: Test Driven Development: By Example
author: Kent Beck
synopsis: Demonstrates the principles and practices of test-driven development (TDD) through practical examples in Java.

name: Continuous Delivery: Reliable Software Releases through Build, Test, and Deployment Automation
author: Jez Humble, David Farley
synopsis: Explores techniques for achieving continuous delivery, focusing on automation, collaboration, and feedback loops.

name: Effective Java
author: Joshua Bloch
synopsis: Covers best practices and advanced techniques for writing effective Java code. Includes updated examples for Java 8 and beyond.

name: Patterns of Enterprise Application Architecture
author: Martin Fowler
synopsis: Examines patterns and principles for designing enterprise-level software applications. Discusses architectural styles, patterns, and anti-patterns.

name: Head First Design Patterns
author: Eric Freeman, Elisabeth Robson, Bert Bates, Kathy Sierra
synopsis: Presents design patterns in a visual and engaging format, making them easier to understand and apply. Includes examples in Java.

name: The Art of Computer Programming
author: Donald E. Knuth
synopsis: A comprehensive multi-volume work on computer programming, covering algorithms, data structures, and mathematical concepts.

name: Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs
author: Harold Abelson, Gerald Jay Sussman, Julie Sussman
synopsis: Introduces fundamental concepts of computer science and programming. Covers abstraction, recursion, and higher-order procedures.

name: Introduction to Algorithms
author: Thomas H. Cormen, Charles E. Leiserson, Ronald L. Rivest, Clifford Stein
synopsis: A comprehensive textbook on algorithms, covering design techniques, analysis, and implementation. Includes pseudocode and real-world examples.

name: Cracking the Coding Interview: 189 Programming Questions and Solutions
author: Gayle Laakmann McDowell
synopsis: Prepares readers for technical interviews with practice questions and solutions covering data structures, algorithms, and problem-solving.
